Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Senior Business Systems Analyst

Our client, a leading financial services company based in Boston, is looking for a motivated and forward-thinking Senior Business Systems Analyst. This individual will have a focus on data product management, analytics development, and a strong ownership mindset. The Senior Business Systems Analyst will collaborate with analytics, data engineering, and QA teams to create, test, and deploy data-driven analytics solutions on a global scale. The role encompasses involvement in all technology-driven projects from initial conception through implementation and ongoing support. This position requires the ability to foster relationships with key stakeholders and deliver impactful, technology-driven products that provide actionable insights and drive operational efficiency across various business units. This is a hybrid role, requiring 3 days per week onsite.




Responsibilities:

Develop and implement data-driven analytics solutions for business units, utilizing cloud data warehouses and business intelligence platforms
Act as a liaison between business users and development teams to manage the successful implementation of both large and small-scale products, addressing complex challenges
Lead analytics projects while ensuring adherence to high project standards and timely delivery
Evaluate and recommend technology solutions to ensure alignment with business needs, identifying potential risks, opportunities for improvement, and financial impacts
Gather, document, and validate business requirements for analytics initiatives, including data requirements, data flows, modeling, workflow designs, and user interface designs
Establish and maintain strong working relationships with business and technical stakeholders
Balance the duties related to production support with tasks surrounding data product development and management
Contribute to the creation of data product roadmaps that align with overall business strategies




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, business analytics, data science, management information systems, or finance/economics
3+ years of experience working with business teams to support data product management and development; consulting experience a plus
Familiarity with data science coursework or certifications
Strong communication skills (verbal and written), with the ability to present complex concepts clearly to diverse audiences
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships across teams
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools (Tableau required, Power BI preferred)
Full lifecycle experience in complex data analytics product implementations, including agile methodologies (Scrum)
Expertise in data modeling, transformation, and cloud technologies (AWS, Snowflake)
Experience with ETL tools (dbt) and technology architectures (data lakes, cloud environments, web interfaces, relational databases)
Ability to manage multiple priorities, proactively solve problems, and meet deadlines
Experience with reporting in financial systems like Workday ERP and Workday HCM/Financials is a plus




Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Our client is an equal opportunity employer. They welcome and encourage applications from individuals who are underrepresented in their respective occupations or positions.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
Full Time Direct Hire

No Sponsorship

No Relocation - Local candidates only (Boston, MA)

F2F interview is required

Onsite in Boston 2 days/week




BI Data Modeler

ETL
Dashboards
Data Modeling




Reporting to the Director of Business Intelligence of Enterprise Data and Solutions of Information Technology, the Data Modeler is a key member of the Business Intelligence team responsible for the design of data model solutions that reduce data redundancy, streamline the movement of data, ensure data security and privacy standards, and improve overall institutional data management. The Data Modeler will be accountable for analyzing and translating business needs into long-term, sustainable data models across various data subject areas including Enrollment Management, Academic Affairs, Campus Life, Finance, and Human Resources by transforming various applications data sources into a centralized data platform. Excellent data query and data analytical ability with strong academic and college business knowledge are essential.




ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Develop plan for business intelligence initiatives, recommend innovative technologies, methods, and industry-leading data modeling tools and best practices, design and maintenance of a system to warehouse data and information, including structured and unstructured data sets. Organize and transform data into comprehensible data models.
Map data from new sources to the central data model to support the creation of new or extension of existing reports/dashboards and perform data validation. Provide requirements and execute data extraction, transformation, and load procedures.
Support Argos and Tableau platforms through building data pipelines to facilitate the growth of dashboards and incorporate new and diversified data sources.
Manages all technical aspects of our business intelligence environment, including data transformation and governance, performance monitoring and identification and support of analytics tools. Conduct regular architecture, security, data management, permissions reviews to enable proper data access/management to sources.
Use complex data analysis and query, data science and data modeling techniques to develop reports and data analytics solutions. This includes engineering solutions in the form of business dashboards, reports and data visualizations integrating with internal and external public data sources like College Board or IPEDS. Provide statistical analysis of data, predict trends on business and academic performance, use data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns.
Actively organize data literacy, report and dashboard training to key business users. Focus on storytelling to solve practical business issues and evolve data analytics for department engagement.
Partner with academic units and business departments such as Institutional Research, Enrollment Management, Registrar, Finance, HR, Financial Aid and Institutional Advancement to define and analyze data needs, gather reports or data requirements, perform data mapping to create BI solutions to solve business issues. This often involves conducting complex root cause analysis to troubleshoot data discrepancies, work with end users to correct business processes, and systematically cleanse inaccurate data sets.
Identify, collect and maintain data sets to effectively support the publishing and performance of relevant business area metrics and KPIs including Enrollment Management, IR, IA, Academic Affairs, Finance, HR, IT and MTP.
Effectively work and collaborate with PMO on BI projects, ensure deliverables are completed on time, and objectives are met.
Manage tables and data views within Oracle database, SQL Server, PostgreSQL and synchronize with data models using appropriate ETL tools. Keep current on the latest technologies, develop proof-of-concept data model prototypes to advance the BI program. Commit to professional development by fostering a climate of team learning, cross-training and knowledge base building.
Handle complex data issues with minimal supervision, while escalating critical issues to management using sound judgment. Enforce data quality, knowledge retention, and process consistency through the curation and expansion of the institutional data dictionary/catalog.
Communicate effectively with internal team and external business users through written, verbal and visual storytelling. Develop detailed technical specifications, data mapping and data flow documentations for major data analytics projects.
Perform other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS – Qualifications are deemed required or preferred and represent what is needed to effectively perform job.

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Business or a similar degree, combined work experience and education as equivalent
10 years’ combined experience as data modeler, business intelligence analyst or advanced report writer
6 years’ experience in database systems management. Hands on experience in data model/data warehouse design. Solid understanding of dimension/fact table structure and data aggregation.
5 years of experience in ETL tools and procedures
Programming language(s) for ETL and data pipelining
3 years of Tableau or other dashboard development experience
Higher Education experience preferred
Experience working with Ellucian Banner, Slate, Canvas or Workday preferred
Experience with HelioCampus preferred

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES – May be representative, but not all-inclusive, of those knowledge, skills, and abilities commonly associated with the job.

Demonstrated organization, creativity, and agile problem-solving approach to resolve problems of diverse scope and complexity within deadlines.
Excellent organizational, creativity, and problem-solving skills.
Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively.
Active participation in organization level activities and events related to learning, training, special projects etc.
Experience ingesting, organizing, and representing data within a data model in formats that are easy to use, understand and meet business objectives.
Expertise in defining and managing relational data, dimensional data, unstructured data, and master data to effectively translate and communicate data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Can develop end-to-end solutions from constructing the data set to visualizing information in a tool like Tableau or Argos reports and dashboards.
Demonstrates best practices to use modern layouts, typography and interaction design.
Excellent knowledge on data modeling, data extraction and data transformation using SQL, PostgreSql, Oracle or ETL tools.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to deliver messages and ideas effectively for different audiences.
Experienced with data mapping, business process analysis, criteria and data flow documentation in written or visual format.
Excellent presentation and storyboarding skills.
Experience working with data models or data warehouses.
Capable of working on problems of diverse scope and complexity, is resourceful in developing solutions encompassing challenges to deliver solutions before the deadlines.
Following standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data to obtain trustworthy results.
Is a fast learner and able to apply new and emerging technologies to the existing BI product portfolio to achieve meaningful business outcomes through applying complex data analysis, data science and the data modeling techniques, from descriptive and diagnostic analytics to more advanced predictive modeling.
Ability to keep updated on the latest technologies with technology training and professional development.
Self-motivated, responsible and detail oriented.
Ability to work independently and with a team.
Strong SQL query, PL/SQL and Oracle relational databases skills
Strong Excel skill and efficient use of visual tools
Ability to optimize performance of data models
Experience working with data stewards and data governance
Knowledge of SDLC and project management best practices
Familiarity with AWS Redshift or Snowflake preferred
Python or other scripting or data integration technologies preferred

Show more

Title: Coordinator, Insights
Description:
DEPARTMENT OVERVIEW:

The Partnership Sales team at Fenway Sports Management serves as a fully integrated sales organization for Fenway Sports Group. The team is responsible for driving significant revenue, working with FSG’s owned and operated properties as well as strategic partners across the portfolio. We accomplish our goals by cultivating relationships with world-class brands and providing customized solutions to tell powerful stories through the iconic properties that we work with.

POSITION OVERVIEW:

This role will support the administration and optimization of FSM’s Salesforce environment, driving continued improvements in its efficiency and effectiveness to support the sales effort. This includes supporting key administrative functions, ensuring data accuracy, managing user accounts, and providing support for day-to-day operations. In addition to CRM support, this role will actively support partnership insights workflow, providing data analysis support for sales collateral across properties. This role will directly contribute to data-driven decision-making across the organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Support Analyst, Partnership Insights & Intelligence to drive efficient and effective CRM operations.
Assist with consumer insights, research, social media measurement, and broadcast valuation research.
Champion data quality and integrity, serving as a liaison with internal teams (finance, accounting) to ensure reporting accuracy and facilitate cross-property information sharing.
Create and maintain reports to increase day-to-day effectiveness and ensure cross-departmental access to critical information for all stakeholders.
Ensure seamless user functionality by managing and creating key functionality, resolving errors, addressing user issues, and maintaining system performance.
Create CRM user guides to ensure consistency, streamline operations, and promote knowledge sharing.
Conduct in-depth research on CRM functionalities to identify optimization opportunities and align with business needs.



CHARACTERISTICS/QUALIFICATIONS:


1+ years of professional experience in CRM, insights, market research, or a related field.
Experience with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, preferably Salesforce.
Skilled in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Microsoft Excel, and quick to learn new tools.
Strong attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
Experience or strong interest in sports and entertainment sponsorship.
Committed to data integrity and optimizing CRM processes.
Strong communication skills, able to present complex data clearly.
Experience with syndicated research tools (e.g., YouGov, Nielsen, MVPIndex).
Excellent written & verbal communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex data into clear, concise reports and presentations.



#FSM

At the Boston Red Sox and Fenway Sports Management, we go beyond embracing diversity. We’re committed to living by our values, strengthening our community, and creating a workplace where people genuinely feel like they belong.

Too often, job seekers don’t apply to positions because they don’t meet every qualification. If you love this role and are great at what you do, we encourage you to apply. Your unique skills and experiences might just be what we’ve been looking for.

Prospective employees will receive consideration without discrimination based on race, religious creed, color, sex, age, national origin, handicap, disability, military/veteran status, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression or protected genetic information.

Title: ML Data Associate-II, Artificial General Intelligence
Description:
Description

AI is the most transformational technology of our time, capable of tackling some of

humanity’s most challenging problems. Amazon is investing in generative AI and

the responsible development and deployment of large language models (LLMs)

across all of our businesses. Come build the future of human-technology

interaction with us.

We are looking for those candidates who just don’t think out of the box, but make

the box they are in ‘Bigger’. The future is now, do you want to be a part of it? Then

read on!

Key job responsibilities

Maintain and follow strict confidentiality as customer privacy is our most

important tenet

Work with a range of different types of data including, but not limited to:

text, speech, audio, image, and video

Deliver high-quality labelled data, using guidelines provided to meet our

KPIs and using in-house tools and software, as part of Amazon's commitment

to developing and deploying AI responsibly.

Demonstrate proficiency in generating high quality human insight data

across a range of modalities, inclusive of text, image video and audio.

Capable of making sound judgments and logical decisions when faced with

ambiguous or incomplete information while performing tasks.

Eye for detail and ability to pivot from one category of requirement to

another instantaneously.

Demonstrate support on daily operational deliverables for multiple task

types assigned to you and the team

Analyze root causes, identify error patterns, and propose solutions to

enhance the quality of labeling tasks and their outputs.

Responsible for identifying day-to-day process and operational issues in

Standard Operating Procedure, tools and suggest changes to unblock

operations

Demonstrate ownership in floor support to clarify internal queries during

execution on need basis

A day in the life

We are looking for a ML Data Associate (MLDA) to undertake the task of

foundational labeling functions, such as dialogue evaluation on speech, text, audio,

video data.

Your ability to concentrate, multi-task and your high attention to detail helps you

deliver high-quality work as well as maintaining strict confidentiality and follow all

applicable Amazon policies for securing confidential information. You will be a part

of a diverse team with the shared vision of improving customers’ lives with

practical, useful generative AI innovations. An inner drive, individuality, and a

creative mind are extremely beneficial

Basic Qualifications

An Associate’s Degree or related work experience

C1+ or equivalent fluency in X language (Specify by location and locale)

Strong business writing skills with ability to create reports, proposals, and

professional correspondence

Advanced reading comprehension with ability to analyze complex business

documents

Developed analytical thinking and structured problem-solving capabilities

Strong ability to interpret and implement detailed instructions across

various projects

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2868339

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Resolute Management, Inc. is a Third-Party Administrator hired by clients to handle complex environmental, asbestos, and/or latent type insurance claims. We are proud to be an affiliate of the Berkshire Hathaway group of insurance companies and we believe our structure allows our employees to experience the benefits of a large company with a friendly, small company atmosphere. Our headquarters are located in Boston, MA, and we have additional offices located in Chicago, Philadelphia, and Stamford, CT.

 

 

POSITION SUMMARY: 




The Quantitative Analyst works on a team of professionals with risk modeling expertise in environmental insurance claims focusing on scrubbing and synthesizing data, developing models to simulate complex claim outcomes, performing quality assurance of models, and presenting results to management for use in strategy and decision making. As a member of the team, this role will work with stakeholders in the Claims and Legal departments to understand needs, requirements, and expectations. This is a highly independent position which will require strong analytical, problem solving, communication and documentation skills.




DUTIES:




Build and calibrate models that forecast impact of environmental claims (hazardous waste and asbestos) to various client companies through analysis of financial and legal issues. 
Participate in annual reserving initiatives from data collection to model design and execution.
Provide quantitative support to other departments to address specific business questions, solutions, or plans. 
Generate ad hoc reporting for management and clients.




PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS:




Find creative solutions to problems when limited information is available. 
Capable of managing an assigned project with a wide degree of independence. 
Attentive to detail. 
Organizational and prioritizing skills.
 Ability to produce work in a short amount of time, if necessary.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn how to adopt and utilize new systems and procedures.




EDUCATION:




Bachelor of Science in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Accounting).




EXPERIENCE:




5-8 years’ experience in data analysis (statistical or financial), preferably in the insurance industry. 
Understanding of mathematical modeling and forecasting methods and how to apply them to complex scenarios incorporating multiple variables and constraints. 
Ability to solve qualitative problems quantitatively and present or explain solutions to an audience with a limited math or computing background.
Advanced user of Excel with experience writing lengthy formulas, manipulating large sets of data and summarizing results. 
Must have experience working with data sets, enjoy spreadsheets, and have an affinity for systems.

 







Job Type: Full-time
